title: Willie McGinest shares how his No. 55 became an iconic piece of USC, Patriots history
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Willie McGinest adopted No. 55 at USC, a tradition started by Junior Seau, and carried it to the Patriots.
McGinest wore No. 55 for the Patriots from 1994 to 2005, leading in sacks and winning three Super Bowls.
Junior Seau sought McGinest's blessing to wear No. 55 in New England, continuing the jersey's legacy.

title: Snow totals: See how much your town received
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Essex County received the most snowfall with up to 13 inches recorded in several locations including Salisbury and Beverly.
Northeastern Massachusetts, particularly Essex County, experienced the heaviest snowfall during the February 7, 2026 storm.
Snow totals varied across counties, with Barnstable receiving less than an inch and Bristol up to 8.2 inches.

title: For all he’s done, Mike Tirico will experience ‘thrill of a lifetime’ calling first Super Bowl for NBC
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Mike Tirico will call his first Super Bowl for NBC, covering the Patriots vs. Seahawks game in Santa Clara, California.
Tirico will follow his Super Bowl duties by hosting NBC's Olympic studio program, "Primetime in Milan," from Levi's Stadium.
Tirico, now NBC's lead play-by-play for NBA, has covered five Olympics, the Kentucky Derby, US Open golf, and Indianapolis 500.

title: 60 fun facts, stats, and things to know about Super Bowl LX before Patriots take on Seahawks
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The New England Patriots face the Seattle Seahawks in Super Bowl LX at Levi's Stadium in Santa Clara, California.
Patriots quarterback Drake Maye is the second-youngest to start a Super Bowl and could become the youngest winner at 23.
The Seahawks had the NFL's sixth-best defense by yards allowed and led in scoring defense, allowing 17.2 points per game.

title: Patriots’ Mike Vrabel reportedly received pointers from Bill Belichick and a rival coach ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots' head coach Mike Vrabel consulted Bill Belichick and Andy Reid before coaching his first Super Bowl.
Vrabel relied on offensive coordinator Josh McDaniels's extensive Super Bowl experience for strategic preparations.
Vrabel led the Patriots to a 14-win season, winning Coach of the Year, and simulating a Super Bowl halftime during practice.

title: 5 things at stake during the Patriots’ Super Bowl rematch with the Seahawks
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The Patriots aim to win their seventh Super Bowl, potentially breaking the NFL record for most Super Bowl wins.
Quarterback Drake Maye seeks to join elite company by winning a Super Bowl in his second season.
Coach Mike Vrabel could become the first to win a Super Bowl with the Patriots as both player and coach.

title: Stefon Diggs hopes Super Bowl LX can strengthen Hall of Fame case. Would a win put Patriots’ WR in Canton?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Stefon Diggs hopes a Super Bowl LX win will bolster his Hall of Fame candidacy.
Diggs has one first-team All-Pro honor and four Pro Bowl selections in his career.
Diggs ranks 38th all-time in receiving yards and 43rd in receiving touchdowns.

title: Would the Patriots’ dynasty have ever happened without new Hall of Famer Adam Vinatieri?
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Adam Vinatieri inducted into Pro Football Hall of Fame for Class of 2026.
Vinatieri won three Super Bowls with Patriots, including game-winning field goals.
Vinatieri played 24 NFL seasons, scored 2,673 points; known for clutch performance.

title: Mike Vrabel throws a wrinkle in Patriots’ final practice ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots coach Mike Vrabel simulated long Super Bowl halftime by sending team to locker room during final practice.
Patriots' practice involved usual rituals and music from Super Bowl performer Bad Bunny ahead of Sunday's game.
Quarterback Drake Maye practiced fully, while Harold Landry III and Robert Spillane were limited due to injuries.

title: Patriots-Seahawks Super Bowl will likely come down to which quarterback makes the fewest mistakes
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Patriots and Seahawks face off in Super Bowl LX, led by QBs Drake Maye and Sam Darnold.
Patriots' defense, led by Milton Williams, aims to challenge Seahawks' high-powered offense including WR Jaxon Smith-Njigba.
Seahawks' QB Sam Darnold has no postseason turnovers, while Patriots' Drake Maye overcame early playoff mistakes.
